title: Anger and aggressivity is not the answer
body:
When someone have a bad game , being angry at them or just insulting them , won't make your game easier or give you a Instant victory, you could instead try to help the person in difficulty and see what you can do to use this situation to improve your teamwork and try to work this out as a team. Bashing down your allies doesn't solve anything. It create more stress and make people lose focus. The person in difficulty just end playing even less focused and do mistake , and the players who cuss on him , lose focus on victory and just spam the chat with insult thinking it will change anything. It's easy to bash someone behind your screen but would you bash someone randomly on the street? I don't think so. Find a new ways to solve your problem than let your anger spread on your game, sincerely,
a player who got enought of the daily anger.

If you get offended over words on a screen this isn't overkill. This community is actually BuzzFeed material r words.

> When someone have a bad game , being angry at them or just insulting them , won't make your game easier or give you a Instant victory,

It may make my game easier or have a greater chance of a victory. It's based on how the player handles and perceives flame.

> you could instead try to help the person in difficulty and see what you can do to use this situation to improve your teamwork and try to work this out as a team. 

That doesn't always work.

> Bashing down your allies doesn't solve anything. It create more stress and make people lose focus.

This may only be true in the case were it is constant flame, but flaming once in a while won't lead to this.

> The person in difficulty just end playing even less focused and do mistake , and the players who cuss on him , lose focus on victory and just spam the chat with insult thinking it will change anything.

Like i said, it depends on how the person in difficulty handles flame.

> It's easy to bash someone behind your screen but would you bash someone randomly on the street?

If the person didn't do anything wrong, why would i bash him?

>  Find a new ways to solve your problem than let your anger spread on your game, sincerely,
> a player who got enought of the daily anger.

The way i express my anger at players helps me win games sometimes, so I'm not about to stop just because you feel differently.

Being nice to people isn't always the solution, it sometimes leads to the person to stop trying or to not be cautious of mistakes, because they know their going to be coddled every time. Putting pressure on someone or showing them that you won't tolerate silly mistakes, may have the opposite affect. Take lessons from Koreans

98% of the time the individual you're harassing isn't going to be some sort of masochist. 

It doesn't work that 2% of the time. 

Just because you said X is true doesn't mean X is true. 

98% of the time....

Why do you feel the need to bash someone if they do something wrong? 

There's positives and negatives to almost every situation. 

It's unrealistic to expect everyone's going to take your *anger* purely as advice. Coddling is going to ruin them? Sure. Ya know, it's all up to those numbers. Some respond positively to flame, some don't, most don't. Not to mention that the majority of flamers are about as resilient to other BMers as a tin can is to a hammer.

And that might explain why almost every individual on the football/basketball team was a bit of a jerk at my old school. Only knew 2 decent individuals out of the bunch who didn't try and mock random folks in the hallway. New Asian student? Scream 'ri-aaaaay-ce' in the hallway as they're walking by. You're working hard at the same table as them? "Oh, you're really working it, X?" Accidentally looked (oopsie) at one when he was walking home with some of his friends and he took it a bit personally. So what does Mr. Jock do? He gets up in my face and says, "You wanna fight?" Didn't fight, but fun times. 

Anyhow, an actual argument instead of personal experience: This is a video game, that's a real life sport. League? Most of the players lean towards the casual side from what I know and aren't looking to be berated by some angry, insecure wreck whose JUST looking for a way to vent life's frustrations(The criticism they give usually ain't the same as coaches, sorry). Oh yeah, and you're probably only going to see most players once or twice, so that "you and everyone on my teams sucks but ME" attitude isn't going to improve anyone in the course of a game or two. Your high-school basketball team? A bit of a long time commitment, there. 

And, well, the toxicity you find in league is farrrrr harsher from what you'd find your typical high school/college sport's coach shouting. And one almost always knows when to stop if he/she ever goes too far and is willing to give out compliments, the other doesn't and won't. 

Also, as said in my previous post, most of the individuals who troll/flame in league are no more resistant to their own BS than the people they harass. They're insecure, stressed out, and angry at the thought of losing one of their Oh Soooo precious normal/ranked/EvenUrf games, so they flame, and it doesn't help. In fact, they're probably lowering their chance to win by a small amount, and in some cases, even a significant amount.
